data.title: Estimate: EUR 10,000 to EUR 13,000
data.meta_description: (1781–1858)Portrait of the Twins Elisabeth Ludovika (1801-1873) and Amalie Auguste (1801-1877), Princesses of Bavaria, Daughters of King Maximilian I Joseph of Bavaria, oil on panel, 31.5 x 40.5 cm, oval cutout 30 x 39 cm, framed
data.text:
Compare:

Ulrike von Hase, Joseph Stieler 1781–1858. Sein Leben und sein Werk, Munich 1971, no. 42.

This hip-length double portrait, attributed to the Bavarian court painter Joseph Karl Stieler, depicts the twin sisters and daughters of the first King of Bavaria, Maximilian I Joseph, and his second wife Caroline Wilhelmine of Baden in front of an idyllic landscape. Amalie Auguste of Bavaria (Munich 1801-1877 Dresden) married John of Saxony in Dresden in 1822 and was Queen of Saxony from 1854 onwards. Her sister, Elisabeth Ludovika of Bavaria (Munich 1801-1873 Dresden), was the wife of Frederick William IV King of Prussia. She worked hard to maintain the close relations between Prussia and Austria and was the aunt of Empress Elisabeth (‘Sisi’) of Austria.

Compare:

Ulrike von Hase, Joseph Stieler 1781–1858. Sein Leben und sein Werk, Munich 1971, no. 42.

This hip-length double portrait, attributed to the Bavarian court painter Joseph Karl Stieler, depicts the twin sisters and daughters of the first King of Bavaria, Maximilian I Joseph, and his second wife Caroline Wilhelmine of Baden in front of an idyllic landscape. Amalie Auguste of Bavaria (Munich 1801-1877 Dresden) married John of Saxony in Dresden in 1822 and was Queen of Saxony from 1854 onwards. At present, there is no adequate level of data protection in the USA, and it cannot be excluded that state security authorities may issue corresponding orders to the third-party providers (Google and Meta Platforms, Inc.) to gain access to the aforementioned data for control and monitoring purposes. There are no effective remedies or legal protection against this. Moreover, the US does not provide adequate guarantees for the protection of personal data. However, since we only forward your IP address (in shortened form, so that no clear identification is possible) and technical information such as browser, Internet provider, terminal device and screen resolution to Google, we consider the risk to be moderate and the probability of actual access to your data rather low.

When you visit our website, the following data, among others, is recorded:

Pages viewed

Your behaviour on the pages (e.g. clicks, scrolling behaviour and stay time length)

Your approximate location (country and city)

Your IP address (in shortened form, so that no clear identification is possible)

Technical information including browser, internet provider, terminal device and screen resolution

Source of your visit (i.e. via which website or advertising material you came to us)
